Description: Rim sherd of Laconian, possibly black-figured, pottery kylix; interior glazed black with reserved lines top and bottom; exterior slipped cream; black band at top of rim, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the rim decoration, see British Museum 1888,0601.526.h and 1888,0601.528.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.71)
Johnston 2013 / Trade and Traders: Value, Transport and Places of Exchange (104-5, fig. 9)
